page.statement:
To complete this module you need to pass the following assessment; the passmark is 100%.

We recommend you read the questions carefully before answering. Once you have moved on you cannot return to previous questions.

question.text: Which of the following is the usual duration for food poisoning?

question.ans: The period between eating contaminated food and the first symptoms appearing
The time taken to destroy bacteria during cooking
The time taken by bacteria to multiply after removal from refrigeration
The period during which an ill person has symptoms

question.text: Which of the following is the usual incubation period for food poisoning?
Which of the following are all normally symptoms of food poisoning?
Which of the following statements is true?
question.ans: Food poisoning bacteria multiply slowly in freezers
Reheated food must achieve temperatures of at least 65°C
High standards of personal hygiene should help prevent contamination
Food poisoning usually occurs because of a single isolated mistake

question.text: Which of the following statements is correct?
question.ans: Food poisoning bacteria rarely need to multiply in food to cause illness
Bacterial food poisoning never results in death
If toxins are produced in food the onset time will be long

question.text: Which part of the body is most likely involved in the transfer of food poisoning bacteria to food?
